result.execSummary:
The defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
FIRST 6 MONTHS: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment. 
SECOND 6 MONTHS: Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends relelase to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.
Consecutive to: any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served

miscConds.notes: Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Seek and maintain full time employment. May be part time if enrolled in school.
Obtain high school diploma or GED.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with Digivinder M. or Corey T.
No contact with drug community.

Undergo mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Random urine screens. No positive results.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.
Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatmnt deemed necessary by the department.

timeConds.notes: same release privileges as above, to be used by agent for any violations.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Demitri Devonte Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  Defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor in custody.  Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  FOR BRANCH 02.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.    Sentencing proceeded.    Statements made by counsel and defendant.  
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Court set restitution at $0.  The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 0 days time served, FIRST 6 MONTHS: Huber privileges for work, school, and treatment.  SECOND 6 MONTHS:  Same Huber privileges PLUS Court recommends release to the Day Reporting Center and electronic monitoring.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 years with the following conditions:
*Court imposed but STAYED 30 condition days in the HOC, same release privileges as above, to be used by agent for any violations.
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Undergo mental health assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with Digvinder M. or Corey T.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.  May be part time if enrolled in school.
*Obtain high school diploma or GED.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.


- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he/she may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order signed and filed.  
- Pay all costs and surcharges including the mandatory DNA surcharge, within term of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.

Appeal rights given.

Attorney Anne A. Devitt in court, defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor not in court, in custody.  Joanne L. Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Plea and Sentencing Hearing date.
Case adjourned to 08-06-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Plea and Sentencing Hearing.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor not in court, in custody.  Joanne L Hardtke for the State of Wisconsin is currently in another court.

Atty. Devitt has been unsuccessful in reaching the defendant's probation officer.
Defense requests a scheduling conference date.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 07-15-2014 at 1:30 PM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Adjourned Scheduling Conference.

Attorney Anne A Devitt in court, defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor not in court, in custody.  Catelin A Ringersma for Joanne Hardtke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Matter in court for a Bail/Bond Hearing AND a Scheduling Conference.

Court addressed bail:  State moves for the Court to set bail at $500.00 cash.  Defense requests a lower cash bail.  Arguments heard.  Court set bail at $50.00 cash with TURNOVER TO Justice Point for monitoring.  Conditions of bail release are (1) No contact with the victim AND all other conditions previously ordered.

Parties request a status conference date. 
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 06-25-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Status Conference.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the Defendant.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no alcohol.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Maggie's Grocery Store at 3101 W Glendale Ave.; Milwaukee, WI

Defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor in court with attorney Anne A Devitt.  Defendant Demitri Devonte Taylor in custody.  Randy P Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Donald, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
